instructions: From the Home screen, tap the Apps tray. Tap Messaging . Tap Menu . Tap Settings . Tap Default group message type to enable Group messaging.

From the Home screen, tap the Apps tray. Tap Messaging . Open the message thread of the contact you are sending to or start a new thread. Tap Attach . Tap Video or Image . Tap Capture Video or Take Picture. Capture the video or picture. Tap Done . Continue to compose the remainder of the message. Tap Send .

From the Home screen, tap the Apps tray. Tap Messaging . Open the message thread of the contact you are sending to or start a new thread. Tap Attach . Tap Gallery . Navigate to and select the image you want to attach. Tap Done . Continue to compose the remainder of the message. Tap Send .

From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Settings > General management > Language & input > Text-to-speech . Select the desired TTS engine: Samsung text-to-speech engine Google Text-to-speech Engine Next to the desired search engine, tap the Settings icon. Tap Install voice data . For the Samsung text-to-speech engine, the desired language may already be downloaded. However, you have the option of downloading a higher quality version. Next to the desired language, tap Download or the Download icon. Wait as the language downloads. It may take a few minutes. Tap the Back key. Tap Language to select the language.

From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Settings > Accessibility > Vision > Voice assistant . Tap the VOICE ASSISTANT slider to turn on. This enables your Accessibility settings. You can also enable your Accessibility settings by pressing the Home key 3 times in quick succession. Tap SETTINGS , then tap to adjust the following: Speech volume Text-to-speech Pitch changes Read keyboard input aloud Speak while screen off Mute with proximity sensor Shake for continuous reading Read caller ID aloud Phonetic alphabet Usage hints Vibration feedback Sound feedback Focus on speech audio Sound feedback volume Large cursor Cursor color Quick menu Manage custom labels Keyboard shortcuts Status bar information Developer options

From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Settings > General management > Language & input > Text-to-speech . Move the Speech rate slider to adjust how fast the text will be spoken. Tap the Settings icon next to the desired TTS engine (Samsung or Google). To tap the Settings icon, the TTS engine must be selected. Tap Language to adjust the spoken language.
From the home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Settings > Accessibility > Vision . Tap Voice assistant . Tap the VOICE ASSISTANT slider to turn on.
